website_summaries.verdict: From one of the top names in heavy-duty inflators, it produces up to 150 psi from direct connection to your vehicle’s 12V battery.
pros: Kit includes carrying case, gun, gauge, air hose, and more
You’ll have no problem reaching the rear tires
the standard air hose is 30 feet, and there’s a 30 foot extension, too
Great for RVs and other vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Mine only lasted 15 uses. Over 2 year period
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air pump because I fig it would be the last pump I’d have to buy it’s not cheap. I’ve had it 2 years. Used it maybe 15 times. Today I had a low tire on my truck and it isn’t pumping air anymore. It runs but that’s it. It has a one year warranty Now I have to send it out to have it fixed big bummer if you ask me. I always stored it in bag and didn’t abuse it. Look at picture it’s brand new. 👎🏻👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 29 foot Class A Motor Home. The company could not have made this any easier to work. It's seriously girl proof simple and it does a great job. It's not heavy and so compact. The tote bag it comes in is fantastic and small. Fits right in my RV outside basement area. Every RV owner should carry this. It makes life on the road so much simple verses having to drive around looking for a gas station's air pump that will accomidate your rig. One of the best purchases I've bough.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl steele

customer_reviews.title: Great compressor badly made cheap accessories
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to really like this compressor and I do. The problem is with what comes with the air compressor. during the first use the air hose came broke at the place that it connects to the compressor. This happened after the air chuck and the nice gauge and air trigger leaked causing lots of problems trying to fill a tire. The compressor works fine but the other stuff that comes with it is cheap crap. If you can purchase just the compressor and go elsewhere for all the other stuff I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RV Nomad

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best air compressors I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best air compressors I have owned. Very solidly made and works great. I really like the 90 degree screw on chuck. It allows me to fill the high pressure tires on my Ford F-350 dually with ease and accuracy. The included case allows me to store the compressor and all of its accessories. Wish I had had this compressor when I owned a motorhome. It was well packaged and arrived on time. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs a quality air pump for truck or RV tires. It is a little pricey but in this case you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent was to maintain tire pressure on any recreational vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: A delight to use. Nice storage case that keeps all the components needed to maintain pressure in tires small and large. Nothing else is needed. Connect the hosed and fittings using the supplied quick connectors then clip the wire clamps on a battery. The pump will inflate the hose to 150 pounds and shut off. When the hose is attached to a tire, the compressor starts and runs until the connecton is removed then the compressor once again stops. The included gauge has a large easy to read dial and matched a calibrated gauge within one pound. The hose plus power cable are long enough to easily reach all tires on a 40 ft Motorhome pulling a Jeep.
customer_reviews.author: J. Segers

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money now if you have a motorhome!
customer_reviews.text: So I put off buying this thinking no way it will work that great. I've been through 2 bigger air compressors to find something to get my tires on my motorhome to 120 or 130 psi. No other compressor has been capable. This thing out the box is heavy duty, quiet, and works like a dream! I could not believe how quick it could get my motorhome tires inflated. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Gravois

customer_reviews.title: The one to get
customer_reviews.text: Keeping your dually tires properly aired up isn't just a way to ensure long service life, it is a requirement for safe operation of large, heavy vehicles. I find keeping the dual rear wheels on my Ford E-450 based class C RV to be a pain and was looking for a compressor to make it easier to do and which was high quality. I've tried a couple of compressors from other vendors and they never lasted long and never delivered on the "making it easier" goal. The 400P-RV compressor from Viair delivers! It is solidly built, well packages, and has a high quality feel to it that makes me believe it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Motorhome tire pressures cant wait till “later”
customer_reviews.text: What i love the most about this is convience, i can air tires anytime anywhere, what i like the least is the double foot air chuck, it takes soooo much effort to keep a tight seal on the valve stem its just not usable, they do provide a screw on chuck which can be time consuming however the sealing is 100% just to give you a reference to what i say about the double foot issue, im a mechanic that uses my own tools to air at least 3 to 5 sets of tires at least 5 days a week😎
customer_reviews.author: Richard Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: you'll wonder why you didn't get it earlier
customer_reviews.text: Another product recommended by The RVGEEKS. a very well made sturdy unit. You can tell by it's heft it's made to last. comes with everything you'll need to reach even all tires of a long luxury coach. Nice carrying case that's easy to use and pack up once you're done. Another MUST HAVE for any camper with an RV Works off connection to your battery to eliminates the need for electricity. I found it extremely easy to use and it has already impressed others. Doesn't take up much room and worth it's weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great product if your have a truck with heavy duty ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5th Wheel RV and F-350 truck since the air pressures for these are in the 80+ psi ranges. The only thing I can say negatively is I wish it did not have to have a direct connection to a battery. Beyond that once connected and in use its a breeze and blows up tires EXTREMELY fast. Great product if your have a truck with heavy duty tires requiring 65 to 85 psi and or an RV requiring the same. Smaller compressors cannot get the pressure up in these vehicles. Overall love the product and have used it numerous times with continual success.
customer_reviews.author: WayneZ

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely super product
customer_reviews.text: We are getting older and have bad backs and lugging around a huge compressor to air up our trailer tires is not in the cards for us. All the reviews I saw on this were excellent and I have to agree. My husband loves it and is thrilled. We tried it out on our RV and had no trouble getting it all hooked up and running. It is very light and easy to deal with and comes with a fabulous bag to hold all the parts that you receive along with the compressor. We are super pleased.
customer_reviews.author: boomer lady

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to store. Very easy to setup for use.
customer_reviews.text: What a great compressor. I was able to service all 6 of my RV tires in the time it took to do one with my old compressor.i was a little intimidated by having to hook it to the battery; however, it ended up being quite easy. The extra long hose and long wires make it easy to get to all the tires. It comes with a great carrying bag that accommodates all the parts and room for other stuff too. Be warned, the compressor gets very hot and if you aren’t careful and touch a hot area, it might burn you.
customer_reviews.author: Saintroche

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on first RV trip. Now 6 weeks later I try to use it again on the next trip and the primary hose split. The way its designed, you can’t even use it with the second hose. Poor quality hose.
customer_reviews.author: Dwain S

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I have a way to inflate the air shocks in my work van without having to find an auto repair company. This is small enough to carry in my truck so I can help other motorists and truckers. Does a terrific job inflating my air-shocks to over 100 psi. Van rides much higher now, and built-in pistol grip gauge allows me to instantly see the psi in my tires as well as the shocks. Solidly built, too. Definitely not a "toy" like the all-in-n-one inflation/jump-starter/light/??? type I previously used. Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Failed after first use
customer_reviews.text: Nice carry bag. Purchased in March, 2016. First used ever January 2019. Failed after topping off five of six tires on my Class C. Proving to be a weighty big old paper weight. Look elsewhere for a quality product. Sending it into the manufacturer for repair or replacement or waste of effort, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: TDGrimm

customer_reviews.title: Pressure is an issue
customer_reviews.text: I spent big bucks on this compressor as it was recommended by another RVer for high pressure tires. First time I tried it out in came on and then shut off. I was trying to air a small lawnmower tire, which I did eventually but it took awhile. Not what I expected from this high dollar portable as my cheap portable does it much faster. Plus I noticed the pressure never exceed 20 pounds. Thats makes it worthless for rv tires that require 80 pounds. IE the reason I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: brazos2

customer_reviews.title: Well made and convienent
customer_reviews.text: If you have a RV this is a must purchase item. Easy to use by hooking it up directly to your vehicle's battery with the engine running since the unit pulls some AMPs. Topping off the PSI in your trailer tires is a breeze, mine take 110psi and the unit does better the my pancake compressor. Storage bag contains all the hoses and fittings you will need. Additional storage is useful for a digital gage and some extras. I leave mine in my truck where it is handy and I've seem to get a lot of use out of it for keeping all my vehicles tires at proper PSI.
customer_reviews.author: TX Gal

customer_reviews.title: 2 Year Life span is not enough
customer_reviews.text: Well, we've had this unit for 2 years. It has worked fine, but now is not working. It seems as though the engine is done. For the price, and it's infrequency of use, I expected to get a lot more time and use out of it. I'm disappointed 😔
customer_reviews.author: Tsunamismommy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Little Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: The Viair 400P RV Portable Air Compressor is fantastic little unit. I have a Class B RV (HD Ford Transit Van), and couldn't use the standard automotive air compressors due to electrical cord being too short. I purchased this unit for its air line length and reach. It works great!! It's designed to hook up directly to the vehicle battery. My dual batteries are under the driver seat, so hooking up under the hood to the red positive and negative ground bolt (just like doing a electrical jump) works for the connection. And, this compressor can be used to blowout the waterlines for winterizing... I just purchased the Viair Winterizing Kit.
customer_reviews.author: atomant1

customer_reviews.title: works great. My only beef is that it really needs ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy duty! Very well made. . .works great. My only beef is that it really needs two tire wand attachments. The one that comes with it is great for filling my F53 chassis front and inner dually ties. . .but for the life of me. . .I cannot get it to work with the outer dually tiers. I need to get straight double port wand. . .or one that is bent in the other direction. I'm currently hunting for one on amazon right now.
customer_reviews.author: JonR

customer_reviews.title: A priority for RV, truck and farm owners
customer_reviews.text: I’ve made due with a tank compressor, and dragged it around looking for extension cords too long. This compressor is a little slow when it comes to volume but it sure is easy to carry on trips with a fifth wheel, or across a field to inflate a tractor tire when there is no power around. I think the included accessories are good bonus, the screw on fitting is handy so you don’t have to stay kneeling down to apply pressure, the bag holds everything and keeps it organized and clean. 110psi RV tires are no problem. I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Recommended, The last air pump I will ever buy...
customer_reviews.text: This baby is a tank. I love it but, keep in mind it is not a 50-gallon garage type compressor, it is slow in filling anything but it will fill anything... eventually. It forces air from the compressor without a reserve tank... I bought the RV type for longer hoses and auto shut off, both really nice features. Works great... if you have the time.
customer_reviews.author: SwampFox

customer_reviews.title: the Viair 400p-RV works!
customer_reviews.text: I like this Viair 400p-RV because all you need is there in a nice compact carrying bag, and it works to put air in 19.5 RV tires ( other tires and balls and toys as well) I have used it a bunch since I got it to make sure it works. So far , so good. I got this - I've been kicking it around for a couple years, but it is not cheap- because on our last 26 day trip I needed air in my tires and didn't have a way to top them off. The Viair works great. I did add an inline air dryer to keep moisture out of the tires.
customer_reviews.author: rkanatzar

customer_reviews.title: Rarely is something this good
customer_reviews.text: I have owned portable tire inflators before, but nothing that could handle my RV tires and even tractor tires without tripping out or quitting. This machine is everything it is claimed to be. Quality build and feel. Easy to use. All the attachments you need and hose enough to reach back wheels on a lone trailer. Fairly quiet. Shuts off automatically when connected but not inflating. Best of all inflates big tires without overheating or pauses. In my opinion this is the best portable compressor on the market. Pricey bet well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Herbert

customer_reviews.title: A happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely happy from start to finish with this transaction. The Viair 400P-RV Compressor was received well ahead of anticipated delivery date and all components were exactly as expected. Performance in airing up my Class A RV tires was excellent. I have tried many other portable and oil-type compressors in airing up these tires, all of which were very disappointing. The Viair 400P-RV Compressor, however, not only easily aired the tires but did so in a relatively short period of time. Again, I was very happy with purchase/delivery made through Amazon and performance of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: We use on our travel trailer and tow vehicle. They thought of everything with this setup. Just hook up to battery and it will reach all of your tires without issue. Inflated my tires to 80psi from 70 very quickly. It’s light weight and easy to store. While it was very expensive, it so far is showing it’s worth versus a standard pancake compressor or competing lightweight compressor. If you have the cash, just get it and don’t question your decision.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR RV OWNERS!
customer_reviews.text: Must have for RV owners! If you are trying to air up on the road, at any of those truck stops, or gas stations, then you know getting 100+lbs of air into your tires can take forever - if it is going to happen at all. Plus the money you might spend in quarters... and the busted air hoses on the diesel lanes at the truck stops.... it just isn't worth it! This unit makes up for all of that and helps you keep those expensive tires in tip top shape! This was also recommended by the RV Geeks YouTube channel. So you know it's really good!
customer_reviews.author: Black Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t as good as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a year ago but never had a need for it until now. The temp here was about 37 degrees and I needed to add about 5 lbs to all 6 of tires on our Allegro Bus to get them up to 100#. It took a really long time to complete this task. The unit got extremely hot and melted the hose off the connector at the unit before I was able to finish the last tire. After all the reviews I expected better results.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: What A Relief!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a New RV...was told to always check and correct tire pressure! Sounds easy except the manufacturer low balls the customer with no TMS and no way to check the he dually on the rear😡 Was not funny to me..we had a Roadtrek before that had all the bells and and whistles for a 2008. This compressor meets the need and keeps me from reaching between tires while lying down to get the job done ✅ Not cheap, but a lot better than what I was doing.. I love it! Just use the off set for the inner dually and ....voila, you are ✅
customer_reviews.author: Rellimlm

customer_reviews.title: The finest I've seen for RV owners
customer_reviews.text: Where most 12 V. air compressors will take 30-45 minutes to pump up a flat RV tire to 60 lbs. (if it ever gets there without overheating and shuting off), this will do it in a less than 5 minutes. Personally, I don't want to spend any more time than necessary out along side a major highway than necessary. Everything about this pump is top quality. Yes, it's expensive, But, when you need to adjust air pressure on the road, this is the unit to have.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: These units are awesome! This model
customer_reviews.text: These units are awesome! This model, in particular, is nicer as they automatically shut off when you are not needing to pump air, i.e. checking pressure or moving to a different tire. Well worth the extra money as apposed to buying the other peoples cheaper knock offs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Portable air compressor that’s Great.
customer_reviews.text: This air compressor allowed me to air up 4 low tires on my Bronco in about 10 minutes. They needed 10 to 25 lbs each. The compressor shuts off automatically as I moved from one tire to the next. It comes in a rugged bag with heavy duty nylon zippers for all 3 compartments. There are 2 coiled hoses with fittings that allow for extended reach. The compressor is relatively quiet and is well made. I bought this compressor to air up my (3/4 ton) truck tires to 80 lbs after lowering pressure during off road and no load conditions.....and other things.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R.

customer_reviews.title: This works great. I kind of wish the tire infalting attachment ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to deal with a slow leak in a tire for about a week. It required air to be filled every day. This works great. I kind of wish the tire infalting attachment had a flexible end to it, but I will be replacing it anyways with a PSI gauge inflator/deflator. I am really happy with this. It initially purchased this for my 91 syncro westy for driving on beaches/blm roads. I think it will perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: An RV must have
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this compressor kit when we purchased our fifth wheel camper. Its great for airing the camper tires and our bike tires. @fiftyandfifthwheeling
customer_reviews.author: Fiftyandfifthwheeling

customer_reviews.title: Works great and fills up tires very quickly
customer_reviews.text: This ViAir has been so impressive and I'm amazed at how well it works. I use it on my 22.5 semi truck tires and my 16" G rated tires and it easily gets them over 100psi. One of the things I was not expecting is that when you are not actively pumping up, the pump stops so it's not always running. I debated between the 400 & the 450 due to the duty cycle, but I think the 400 flows more air and therefore pumps up more quickly. I'm happy I did get the 400.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Great Set up for RVs or Off Road Truck Tires
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first one I ordered so this is my second one! Airs up the huge tires on my Diesel Motor Home. It does take a few minutes to reach 115 pounds of pressure in these tires but just keeps going and works great! Perfect for topping off the pressure and lighter than carrying a large compressor. The compressor built into my RV will get up to around 105 but is harder to get to pump them to the 110 or 115. This is much easier and faster. Nice to have one for my car and trailers now.
customer_reviews.author: dan c.

customer_reviews.title: Good option for off road carry. Case will hold ARB tire repair kit and rapid deflator.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for re-inflatting off road tires. The extra extension for a motor home is just an added plus. This unit has an automatic pressure shut off and an overheating cutoff much like a standard 120v air compressor. I am able to put an ARB tire repair kit and a rapid tire deflator into the carry bag along with all the included equipment. Another option would be to remove the extra extension and store even more tire related gear in the included carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: JAL

customer_reviews.title: High quality pump with almost everything you need for all tires including inside truck dually tires
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump! It pumps 70 - 80 lbs in my truck tires very quickly. The two hoses are long enough to reach anywhere on my truck and fifth wheel. Only thing that was absolutely necessary to add for inside dually truck tires is an inexpensive extension tool made specifically to reach the inside dually valve caps for removal and replacement. I did add a separate digital tire pressure gauge and rubber valve caps.
customer_reviews.author: Nighthawk

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and quick
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for RV use. This unit is surprisingly quiet and seems well built but a little on pricey side. The attachments provided (hoses, chuck and inflator gauge) work very well. The auto shutoff is especially convenient. We needed a unit capable of inflating tires to 110 psig.
customer_reviews.author: Snoway

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this air compressor, I carried a good size air compressor in my Rv. for years, and it took up so much space. I finally decided to do some research, and I liked what I read. I purchased it and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Winfield

customer_reviews.title: Poor gauge
customer_reviews.text: The compressor works great, but not the pressure gauge. The gauge is 5-6 psi lower the the actual tire pressure. I checked it against 3 other gauges I have and they were all within 1 psi of each other. I also checked it against the build in tire pressure system in my car and it was the same as two of my gauges.
customer_reviews.author: Harald Hagen

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, well-built, totally efficient, professional grade air compressor with complete set of accessories
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I've ever made. Unbelievable quality and performance from this terrific air compressor. I actually took my Class C motorhome to our local Tire Depot to have them show me how to properly use my new Viair compressor . . . . and the technician that used my Viair unit was absolutely stunned by how efficient it was. He asked me how he could order one of the units for himself and commented on how complete the unit was with the dual air lines, the heavy duty gauge, the two chucks and more. He was very excited about getting off work so he could go home and order one for himself.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: RV air compressor
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Works as described. Very easy to use. Topping off tires is very easy now and gives you great peace of mind that you dont have to squeeze into a gas station to air the tires. Everything fits in the bag. Air lines are long enough to fill all the tires and a tow behind if you have one. Little pricey but money well spent. A must have for rv owners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Compressor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the unit for our RV. We took a trip from the GA to AK, and wanted to make sure we had a compressor to keep our tire pressure up during the trip. It was easy to set-up and use and did an amazing job of quickly filling the tires on our RV to 120psi. The only issue was the gauge that came with the unit. It was not as accurate as my handheld pressure gauge, but not an issue. Filled tires and checked with my handheld gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great air pump!
customer_reviews.text: It is fantastic. It has the power to blow up my tractor and motorhome tires. It works off 12 volt so can be used anywhere you have a 12v battery to hook up the power to. I used it to air the tires in my car so far and it worked great. It is lightweight and portable, small so it doesn't require a lot of room to store. Long enough hoses to reach all the way around my motorhome without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: On a recent trip in my Class C RV, I noticed that I had a soft tire. I tried to find air at 3 different truck stops, but all their systems were out of service. I decided to buy a portable compressor that could fill my tires to the required 80 lbs. This system is perfect. Its self contained, operates off the vehicle's battery, and quickly fills my tires. The canvas carrying bag is handy, and fits all the accessories. It stows easily in my RV's rear "garage". The compressor itself is well constructed and appears durable. Although the price seems a little high, you really get a complete, well made system that is perfect for RV use.
customer_reviews.author: Bruski

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricy, but if you have an rv with high pressure tires, this pump just does the job. I had a leak and aired up my tire from 0 to 87psi in about 6 minutes. I have had other 12volt air pumps,,,and they either got the psi up very slowly,,,,or could not achieve the pressure to air up a higher pressure tire. The tire pumps you find at gas stations where you pay like a dollar do not air up a tire as well as this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adle

customer_reviews.title: The feeling of security
customer_reviews.text: I have been considering buying this air compressor or one like it for weeks. I really did not want to spend this amount of money for one. Viair really like their products $$$ I thought. Well after many weeks, I finally hit the purchase button. I’m so glad I did, this is a well made product that gets the job done, I see why the cost is what it is. This compressor is rock solid. I travel a lot in my Rv and in the last two weeks two of my fellow Rving friends have bought one after seeing this one. If only I could get Commission ! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Stevn

customer_reviews.title: Great portable air compressor
customer_reviews.text: In previous years whenever I needed to air the tires on my 5th wheel I had to load my large air compressor into my pickup and haul it to the trailer. Not anymore! This Viair compressor and accessories kit is a must have for all RVers. It is complete with everything you need and is all packaged in a very nice carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: htg1969

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled, but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for nearly a year. On one hand, there aren't many options for inflating tires up to 120 psi (and even this one can't do it without entering the red zone). But the gauge is way off and the handle hurts my hand. I expect better for the price. Read the directions if you're inflating more than 100 psi.
customer_reviews.author: Livin' the Dream

customer_reviews.title: It’s amazing
customer_reviews.text: ok. i’ve only used it once but it is awesome. my last Rv trip i stopped at numerous gas stations to add air and it was frustrating. i could not get to 80lbs and many pumps. this thing added pressure faster than any station pump i have ever been to. super easy to use. and the attachments are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sawaya

customer_reviews.title: Easily got all 6 tires to 110 PSI
customer_reviews.text: After some frustrating experiences, with less then desirable tire pressures, we made the plunge and purchased this Viair compressor. Easily got all 6 tires to 110 PSI, WHEN COLD. No more stopping at Les Schwabs, whilst the tires are warm, to add pressure. Packs away nice and tight. Simple to run, off a car battery. Plenty of line, to reach all tires and the gauges and valves are top shelf. Had a minor issue with a hose but Viaiar customer service took care of the issue quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: stevog

customer_reviews.title: Best RV Tire Compressor for the Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews on the IRV forum, I purchased this compressor kit for my RV. Have had two opportunities to use it and I love the ease of use. Easy to set up, easy to fill my tires, pressure gauges match by TPMS. Great little machine. Would definitely recommend to my friends. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: laurie raeburn

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but hard to make connections
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this 5 stars, except it's very difficult to connect the quick-connects. Every time I use this I have to fight to make connections, and use a spray lubricant just to make it work. Further more, it's not just one of the quick connect, it's all of them. Other than that, it's a great product
customer_reviews.author: LowPressure

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. It's worth every penny and easy for a lady to use by herself. I drive 1000's of miles towing my fifth wheel trailer. The extra hose allows me to adjust the trailer tires and my airbags on the pickup! I like it so much that I offer to help anyone who needs air just so I can use it!
customer_reviews.author: Keely Costello

customer_reviews.title: This thing is legit.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised I use for my class A RV which requires 120 PSI. This compressor gets there easy enough. Beware it gets HOT so go easy my concern is blowing a seal or something. I will say the first one I received I had to return. One of the hoses separated but the replacement was here in 48 hours and all I had to do was box the old one up, take it to UPS and I was done. The second one I have now I’ve used on four different RVs with zero issues. I’d buy again but hope to never have to.
customer_reviews.author: -bro

customer_reviews.title: Will easily inflate a big truck tire.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant about this compressor. I was worried that it would not inflate the 255/80R22.5 tires on my Class A motor home. Yes!!! It will inflate them to 110 psi no problem. In fact I fully believe it will inflate them to 150 psi. This is a little work horse. Quiet for its size. A complete package. Very impressive. I should have bought this years ago. Would be great on a big truck as well.
customer_reviews.author: PnT Grimes

customer_reviews.title: I love this pump
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump. I originally had a cheap knock off that would overheat after a couple of tires. I offroad and air down 35s to 15psi. I timed it today and it took the same time in manual to inflate. Heavy duty and didn't overheat. I love the auto shutoff feature so the pump shuts itself off if it's not being used. Sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Mad Macs

customer_reviews.title: Fits the need!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a way to air up trailer tires while on long trips. Used first time yesterday and happy with results. Fairly quiet, nice long air hoses, convenient air gun, compact and it all packs in carry case. All connectors fast and tight. Just be patient. Such a small unit takes time. Took about 10 min per tire to go from 70 to 80 psi. Directions state gauge on air gun may read low, so check with your trusted gauge after fill. Make sure vehicle is running, and you connect hoses in proper order.
customer_reviews.author: tekel

customer_reviews.title: Very handy air pump.
customer_reviews.text: It pumps up tires to 80psi no problem in a short amount of time. Nice to have an extra length of hose to reach to a trailer of 5th wheel. Another nice feature, when the pump is turned on, its automatically shuts off once reaches certain psi (meaning it's not running all the time).
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Tops off RV tires quickly. I used to dread ...
customer_reviews.text: Tops off RV tires quickly. I used to dread the time it took to do a simple top off (95-110 psi) The VIAR is quick the price of the speed is after topping off all six tires it is hot to the touch and is not a 100% duty cycle. However, I knew that before going in and wanted speed. I have no regrets and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat McGroin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive compressor.  Great for the RV.
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't used this yet, I can tell it is a quality piece. I bought this unit specifically to use with my RV. I found it was really a hassle to use my regular compressor to fill the tires to 110psi. This unit comes highly recommended by other RVers. I was impressed with the completeness of the kit. It has 50 ft of hose and all the attachments needed for an RV. Additionally, the carry case appears to be very sturdy and capable of storing and protecting the compressor and hoses in the basement without falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Pricey But Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The RV Kit has everything you need to check and air up our motor home tires. The compressor airs up the tires quickly. The canvas case has plenty of room for all of the accessories and more. The kit is pricey but the compressor seem to be well made, the kit comes with extra filters and all the needed accessories.
customer_reviews.author: rdross

customer_reviews.title: peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: i REALLY hesitated spending the money for this model but after just opening it up and using it on our new motorhome, i am REALLY glad i spent the money. I studied a ton of Utube videos that were VERY helpful. It is a well built productt with great attachments and well worth the investment in peace of mind alone. I cant spend to how long it will last but it sure looks like it will outlive the motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Forget the cheaper units as most are junk and will only air large heavy rv’s up To 70 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Needed for airing up large class A motorhome that weighs 42,0000 lbs. I run 120 psi in my steer axle wheels that are 24.5, this unit performed exactly as stated and the kit I got has some extras for RV use that makes life easier and well worth every penny:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and it is perfect for that purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my RV, and it is perfect for that purpose. It can fill even large RV tires quickly and effortlessly. However, I am enjoying it most for the speed with which it can fill car tires, almost instantly. It appears to be well made, and someone put a lot of thought into what accessories were needed for an RV, all of which are included. I also like the case that came with the compressor, which stores all of those accessories and the compressor in a well-organized fashion, with lots of pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have a Class A Diesel Pusher and require 120 PSI for my front tires. This is the small size compressor that really does the job! It is more expensive, but the price is worth the performance and strudy construction. I have owned the compressor for over a year and used it multiple times with the same results. Highly recommend this compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss

customer_reviews.title: This is a traffic compressor
customer_reviews.text: This is a teriffic little compressor. It’s size and it’s power were exactly what I was looking for, to service our motor home, where storage space is always a consideration.
customer_reviews.author: John Poe

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy I finall spent the money and bought this so I don’t have to put up with the cheap, slow compressors
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend this air compressor to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I'd recommend this air compressor to anyone. It's very high quality and works perfect for inflating my motorhome tires to 100+ PSI. It's very quiet too and the automatic shutoff feature is nice to have as well.
customer_reviews.author: Traviscf

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice tool to have, and combine it with a good tire plug kit, to repair tires on the road.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the whole unit. I put the fittings together connected the hoses, hooked the leads to my battery. started the 7.3 diesel that hauls my truck bed camper, took the extended air chuck w/Gage back to my dual tires, the compressor kicked on and off as for the demand for air. the big air Gage was ez to read, and was with in a pound or so of my certified truck gage. I added in some additional tools, along with my tire plug kit right in to the nice canvas bag it comes with, all fit very well. A man can do a lot if he`s got tools to work with.
customer_reviews.author: JACKPINE

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Seasoned RV’ers !
customer_reviews.text: This was highly recommended to us as a great unit to carry along for any tire issues or simply inflating basketballs , bike tires etc. Very versatile, comes with a case for storage in our RV. High powered air source for emergencies and non emergencies alike!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Best compressor on the market for RVs, bar none!
customer_reviews.text: This item works as advertised on our Class A motorhome. I only regret that I did not purchase it the first time. I initially purchased a 150 PSI compressor from Home Depot that did not measure up. I subsequently purchased the Viair and I no longer have a problem putting the right amount of air in my tires. Plus I don't have to wait for the compressor to cycle up again to put air in. A little costly, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great, handy compressor unit
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully to pump up my 19.5 inch RV tires. Easy to use and assemble for use. Only knocked down to 4 stars due to small battery clamps and it heats up relatively quickly. Had to wait about 20 minutes before using again. It does shut off automatically. Otherwise perfect with no more issues pumping up these monster RV tires.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: If you own a Class A motorcoach, this falls under the "don't leave home without it!". This is way faster and a lot quieter than running the onboard generator. Give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kit
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this kit. Easy to use, and a surprising flow rate for such a small pump. The slightly angled extension is perfect for my Ford F350 Dually to reach the inside tire. I haven't found any other extension that has this angle, which is critical to make it useful on my truck. If you have an RV, I would consider this a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.text: My setup: 40' motorhome, six 22.5 inch truck tires, 110 lbs pressure each and limited storage space (full time RV'er). I've used this pump to top off my own tires and some of my neighbors at various RV parks. Unit takes up little space and packs well in the carrying case. All the parts I need are included - even enough hose to reach both sides without moving the pump. You have to follow the manufacturer's direction and not run it for too long because it does get hot. Fits my purpose perfectly. Even pumped a few bike tires with it.
customer_reviews.author: malex

customer_reviews.title: Hoses are difficult to use in colder temps
customer_reviews.text: The hoses become a stiff and tangled mess when the air temperature reaches about 45 degrees and below. For about $20, I was able to buy a cold weather rated air hose with 1/4 NPT fittings, and this modification improved the year round performance of this kit. Hoses aside, this kit worked well for me to inflate tires in the 80 psi range.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K..

customer_reviews.title: Solves alot of problems instantly.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a high (90+ lbs) pressure compressor that is 12 volt and good quality. This unit does that exceptionally well. Out of the box you'll be impressed with the quality and how well thought out the whole unit is.
customer_reviews.author: Neil C.

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. I now have 14 registered vehicles with the DMV (ok ok I'm an "enthusiast") and while my previous cheap-o inflator had done an ok job for the last 7 years, it was starting to fail and I thought it was time to step up my game. This is definitely it. Very well constructed. The hand gun with gauge is great - no longer need to go back to the pump... which could be 40 feet away... to monitor pressure. If your serious about tire pressure and or have loads of tires to maintain... this is the real deal!
customer_reviews.author: Peter G.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 22.5 RV tires. I have one with a slow leak (new tires:-|) it was down to 65 pumped it to 100 in under 5 minutes, didn't actually time to get exact. I am glad I purchased it. I also read in another review and I opted for the same setup to put the trigger valve and gauge between the hoses so I am standing a safe distance from the tire as it is inflating using the screw on hose adapter to the valve stem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hester

customer_reviews.title: It works! It filled my RV tires to 100 ...
customer_reviews.text: It works! It filled my RV tires to 100 PSI with some patience. I threw out the chuck that came with it and replaced it with one that screws on the threads of the valve stem. That saved me a lot of aggravation. But, it works!
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I own a class A RV. I have used this several times to fill or top off my six tires at 110 PSI. The unit work very well and is quite quite while running. Only con is it does get warm to hot when used for long periods of time. (was mentioned in documentation) I jut topped off all of my tire for an upcoming trip this Friday. Love it, will write more after using it a little longer. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: william gordon Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but I was expecting a higher quality grade for the price!
customer_reviews.text: So far the compressor is working fine except that it heats up pretty quickly. Reason for the removed first star. The reason for the removed second one is due to the faulty gauge reader. After inflating my truck and RV tires as per the manuacturer recommended PSI, the drive became very rough and bouncy on the highway. I stopped at the first gas station to find out that all tires were around 7 PSI higher than the manufacturer’s recommendation. I am lucky none of the tires exploded. Currently looking for a better gauge inflator.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Portable Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts about the price of this thing. Could've gone cheaper, but after using this thing, I'm happy with it. Extremely durable, nice accessories and storage pouch. Accurate. I use it on my 5th wheel.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Can finally get my tires to 125LB.
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled with how to inflate and maintained my RV tires. They are to be inflated to 125LB and you can’t just go anywhere to do that. I have an air compressor at home but can only get to about 105LB if I wait long enough when inflating each tire. This does the trick. It took about 5 minutes per tire to go from 100 LB to 125LB but I can finally maintain the tire at the proper spec. As others have said, you have to release the pressure to get a true reading but that is simple. I do recommend this unit and I’m glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Good bit of kit. Man enough for our RV.Everything packs away in purpose made bag, which stores well in locker.Thank you RV Geeks for recommending this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent packaging on both the shipment and the storage bag ...
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far but worked completely as advertised. Excellent packaging on both the shipment and the storage bag used for keeping everything organized. The filler tools and hoses supplied are ideal for my 36' motorhome with doubles on the rear. Yes this is pricey however you get what you pay for in this instance and I am very pleased with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump, used it a few times and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pump, used it a few times and it works great. One small gripe... only one of the two bag clasps works. They are slightly mismatched, and the smaller one does not snap and lock closed. Makes it impossible to use the bag handle to carry. Follow up: emailed Viair customer service regarding the carry bag, they sent out a new bag same day. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Oboeannie

customer_reviews.title: Not enough oomph
customer_reviews.text: This product has received such rave reviews by everyone I was expecting a lot. I was disappointed when I tried topping up a tire on my class A coach from 95 psi to 120 psi. After several minutes of squating and pressing hard against that much pressure I was only able to get it up 10 lbs to 105 psi. The dealer is going to finish the job. I will admit construction is excellent and the bag is well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind while on the road.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit that I purchased to maintain the air in the duelies of my Class B camper van. It is portable and it quickly brings the psi up in low tires. One can check and add air at home or on the road without driving anywhere. It comes with a number of chucks, a dial gauge, sufficient hoses and a carrying case. Applications could include RV, home and offroader.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: This Model is For Heavier RVs and Vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Realize that this model is not for your average vehicle or tire size. It is modeled for heavier vehicles and rvs. I tried to use this on my 35” truck tires On my Ford F-150 but I needed to use the 300P. It would fit the tire but. I couldn’t inflate the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on a few trail rides and a week in Moab - worked great and took my stock BFG TM's from 15lbs to 25lbs quickly and with no struggles. Caught this on sell and it was well worth the money - seems well made and I haven't had any issues with one season of use.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality with a great case.
customer_reviews.text: If you own an RV then you should have one of these or something like this. This is very well made and airs my truck up from 55 PSI to 80 PSI fast. I feel confident in the ability to winterize my trailer quickly and ensure I have good tire pressure prior to hitting the road. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Walker dean

customer_reviews.title: Fast and powerful
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried a number of portable pumps to fill up the air in our truck tires. They all weren’t powerful enough and took forever. This one is fast and does the job. It has made getting ready to go camping a much easier task.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have in your truck, car, RV etc. We have used it and it is an awesome product. We love it. We travel in our 5th wheel and watched a video posted on youtube by LoLoHo. They did an excellent review. We did a lot of research before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a workhorse
customer_reviews.text: It handles my rig if needed and anything around the farm
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Airs tires well - So far not great for winterizing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to fill up tires and winterize my fifth wheel. It does a good job for tires but couldn’t feel any air pressure through the sink faucets when trying to winterize. I Can’t tell if it’s the air compressor or regulator that I’m having problems feeling air come through the system. I should find out after my Florida trip and will report back if anything is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this compressor. It is quick and powerful. Storage case is well designed and handy. The wand nozzle is long enough to reach my inner squally tire. The only thing I find myself wanting is a different nozzle that allows filling of valves pointing away from me.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C. Pardini

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny I spent on this! Almost went with the 400P but so happy I paid the extra money for the 400P RV. I love the screw on air gun hose and easy to fill plus if your over fill just hit the bottom on the side and it will release air. I most have for those going off road it travel trailer in Alaska. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: timothy miller

product_meta.title: Viair 40047 400P-RV Automatic Portable Compressor Kit
product_meta.description: Keep your tires inflated on your RV, trailer, or just about anything else no matter where you go with the Viair 400P RV Automatic Portable 12 Volt, 150 PSI Air Compressor Kit. This 12 volt air compressor hooks up to your vehicle's battery, and with its 150 PSI capacity can inflate 35 inch tires to 30 PSI in less than 5 minutes. This compressor can operate for 40 minutes at a time so you get the job done. This kit comes with everything you need for an air compressor on the go. Besides the compressor itself, it includes a carry bag, inflation gun with pressure gauge, 30 foot hose, 30 foot hose extension, sand tray, set of dual battery clamps, 8 foot power cable, inflation tips kit, and fuse holder. No matter where the road takes you, make sure your wheels are good to go with the Viair 400P RV Automatic Portable 12 Volt, 150 PSI Air Compressor Kit.
feature_bullets: 12 VOLT - 150PSI Max Working Pressure, engine must be running during use. Dimensions- 10.87 L x 5.83 W x 7.48 H inches
2.3CFM Free Flow @ 0 PSI, Power Cord: 8' Air Hose: 60' 12-Volt
Powered direct to the car battery with alligator clamps, Duty Cycle: 33 percent @ 100 PSI Max. Working Pressure: 150 PSI Max. Amp Draw: 30 Amps Tire Inflation Gun with 130 PSI Inline Gauge
Comes with a tire inflation gun and gauge, build in pressure switch, air hose, RV accessories and a carrying case.
Great for adjusting tire pressure on RVs and trailers. Power Cord Length: 8 feet, Primary Air Hose Length: 30 feet, Extension Air Hose Length: 30 feet.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars905 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
